content: minnesota strong hat this hat was inspired by the state flag of minnesota and my love for this amazing place in lieu of payment for this pattern i strongly encourage you to send a small or whatever size you feel is appropriate donation to a food shelf show your love for minnesota in helping others pattern notes this is a simple pattern knit in the round the pattern as written fits an average head circumference of 20-22 and can be adjusted for a variety of sizes you will want a basic knowledge of carrying floats which can be found - with everything else in the world - on youtube materials used cascade 220 superwash in #49 hawaiian ocean cascade 220 superwash in #33 navy white pompom faux fur or yarn us 7 / 4 5 mm needles on 22 cable us 7 / 4 5 mm dpns or a longer cable for magic loop whichever you prefer stitch markers 4 tapestry needle for weaving in ends or magic if you can do that either one stitch counter keen observation skills may be substituted if you re that kind of person gauge listen you can absolutely swatch for gauge - some do some don t blocking can work magic as can ribs on a hat technically gauge for this hat is 20-22 stitches per 4 do with that what you will instructions cast on 96 stitches in the lighter blue color join careful to not twist place a stitch marker at your beginning of round stitch in a k1 p1 rib for as long as you d like the model shown in the pattern has a 1 5 rib which is 14 rounds but you can customize this to your own preference for an average woman s head size this rib will be folded up for convenience and left down for chilly winds we re basically talking about ear coverage here - some love it some don t once your rib is your desired length stop that purling nonsense and just knit a straight stockinette round 1 using your bor marker as your start k24 pm repeat this twice more you should now have 4 equal sections round 2 slip the first stitch in each section k23 round 3 k24 in all sections round 4 sl 1 k23 repeat rounds 3 and 4 until stockinette measures 3 5 or 24 row there should be 12 slipped stitches in each section proceed to the pattern section pattern now we re going to introduce your darker blue yarn and begin carrying your floats i like carrying mine every 4 stitches or so but like vanilla extract and garlic you can measure that with your heart if you prefer a chart to written instructions there is one on the next page from this point on your lighter blue color will be referred to as your mc and your darker blue will be your cc round 1 substituting the darker blue yarn your cc for
